t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    n, s = map(int, input().split())
    res = 0
    while n > 0:
        d = n % 10
        if d > s:
            res += 10 - d
            n += 10 - d
        s -= d
        n //= 10
    print(res)

# SOLUTION

for _ in range(int(input())):
    n, s = map(int, input().split())
    t = sum(map(int, str(n)))
    print(max(0, (s - t) + 9 * len(str(n))))

def main():
    """
    Iterate through test cases, for each test case print the number of moves required to get to the target sum of digits
    """
    t = int(input())
    for _ in range(t):
        n, s = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
        moves = 0
        while sum([int(i) for i in str(n)]) > s:
            n += 1
            moves += 1
        print(moves)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
